intro: Pimelea ligustrina var. hypericina, commonly known as the yellow button bush, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. The variety is distinguished by its more yellowish flowers compared to the typical white or pale yellow of the main species.
